title: How to use Publisher Rocket - A tutorial for authors

tactics.name: Keyword Research with Publisher Rocket
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to find keywords and categories for books by inputting general terms and analyzing search data.
steps: Enter a general keyword or phrase related to the book
Select ebook/book format for targeted search
Click 'Analyze' to retrieve competitor data, monthly searches, and competitive scores
caveats: Initial data appears as dashes until 'Analyze' is clicked
source_quotes: you type in the word click go get a rocket and then what it does is it starts searching the database of words from amazon

tactics.name: Category Selection via Competition Analysis
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to identify profitable categories by analyzing top-selling books and their sales thresholds.
steps: Input keywords into Publisher Rocket's competition analyzer
Sort results by sales volume and bestseller rank
Select categories with achievable sales targets (e.g., 15/day for #10 BSR)
Export category data and cross-reference with book content
caveats: Avoid mismatched categories that could lead to negative reports
source_quotes: you can gather a list of pathways that suit you
if your book doesn't actually fit in that category people are going to get pissed

tactics.name: Organize by Bestseller Rank
tactics.description: Sort books by bestseller rank to identify visibility opportunities
steps: Use Publisher Rocket to sort by least sales
Filter through results to find matching books
Check Amazon page for top 50 visibility
caveats: Books outside top 50 may still gain visibility
source_quotes: you can organize it so the lowest uh bestseller rank to the highest

heuristics.name: Low Review Threshold Boost
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews is less than 200, prioritize keywords
source_quotes: i've only started using it relatively recently within the last couple of months

heuristics.name: Low Competition Boost
heuristics.condition: If competitive score is below 40, prioritize keywords for ad campaigns
source_quotes: anything under 40 would be good... lower competition

heuristics.name: Low Review Threshold Optimization
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize categories with achievable sales targets
source_quotes: for a new author... not very achievable whereas for example 15... is doable

heuristics.name: Keyword Volume Optimization
heuristics.condition: If keyword volume is higher than 100, prioritize
source_quotes: 200 keywords having 200 keywords is better than having 100

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket provides estimated Amazon search data for keyword analysis
source_quotes: estimated amazon searches will give you a rough idea

claims.statement: Books with lower competitive scores gain better ad visibility
source_quotes: if you use that keyword... better chance of getting your ad shown

claims.statement: Amazon allows up to 10 categories per book format (ebook/physical)
source_quotes: i think it's i don't know if it's 10 categories overall or if it's 10 per ebook
the overall best seller rank number is updated hourly

niche_patterns.example: mermaid books + niche market + low competition
niche_patterns.description: Target specific niches with constrained competition using keyword analysis
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Low review counts and competitive scores indicate underserved markets
